phrase_cn: 直到你们**领受**从上头来的能力
phrase_en: Until you are **clothed with** power from on high
sentence_context: And behold, I am sending the promise of my Father upon you. But stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.
nuance_note: Clothed with 形象地描绘能力像外衣一样‘穿戴’在身上，[Get] 太干瘪。

phrase_cn: 他**醒悟过来**
phrase_en: But when he **came to himself**
sentence_context: But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have more than enough food, but here I am dying of hunger!
nuance_note: Came to himself 是极佳的习语，表示恢复理智，[Woke up] 像是刚睡醒。

phrase_cn: 我来本不是召义人，乃是召罪人悔改。
phrase_en: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.
sentence_context: And Jesus answered them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”
nuance_note: The verb 'call' (καλέω) implies an invitation to a new way of life and transformation, not merely a summons.

phrase_cn: 我告诉你们，一个罪人悔改，在天上也要这样为他欢喜，胜过为九十九个不用悔改的义人欢喜。
phrase_en: Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
sentence_context: Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
nuance_note: 'Joy in heaven' (χαρὰ ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ) emphasizes the divine delight and celebration over spiritual conversion.

phrase_cn: 人子来，为要寻找、拯救失丧的人。
phrase_en: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.
sentence_context: And Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor. And if I have defrauded anyone of anything, I restore it fourfold.” And Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, since he also is a son of Abraham. For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
nuance_note: 'Lost' (ἀπολωλός) refers to those who are spiritually astray, condemned, or in danger of perishing, not merely misplaced.

phrase_cn: “主的灵在我身上，因为他膏了我，叫我传福音给贫穷的人；差遣我报告：被掳的得释放，瞎眼的得看见，叫那受压制的得自由，报告神悦纳人的禧年。”
phrase_en: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed, to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor.”
sentence_context: And he unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed, to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor.”
nuance_note: 'Good news' (εὐαγγελίσασθαι) is the gospel message of salvation and liberation, not just generally pleasant information. 'Poor' (πτωχοῖς) includes those spiritually destitute.

phrase_cn: 你们要慈悲，像你们的父慈悲一样。
phrase_en: Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
sentence_context: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
nuance_note: 'Merciful' (οἰκτίρμων) denotes deep compassion and pity that motivates active help and forgiveness, reflecting God's character.

phrase_cn: 那税吏却远远地站着，连举目望天也不敢，只捶着胸说：‘神啊，开恩可怜我这个罪人！’
phrase_en: But the tax collector, standing far off, would not even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
sentence_context: But the tax collector, standing far off, would not even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’ I tell you, this man went down to his house justified, rather than the other. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
nuance_note: 'Be merciful' (ἱλάσκομαι) in this context is a plea for propitiation or atonement, seeking God's forgiveness for sin.

phrase_cn: 我告诉你们，不是的！你们若不悔改，都要如此灭亡！
phrase_en: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
sentence_context: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
nuance_note: 'Repent' (μετανοέω) signifies a fundamental change of mind, attitude, and direction in life, leading to spiritual transformation.

phrase_cn: 我告诉你们，一个罪人悔改，在神的使者面前也是这样为他欢喜。
phrase_en: Just so, I tell you, there is joy before the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
sentence_context: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I had lost.’ Just so, I tell you, there is joy before the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
nuance_note: 'Joy before the angels' (χαρὰ ἐνώπιον τῶν ἀγγέλων) indicates the divine approval and celebration of a sinner's turning to God.

phrase_cn: 并且人要奉他的名传悔改、赦罪的道，从耶路撒冷起直传到万邦。
phrase_en: and that repentance and forgiveness of sins should be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
sentence_context: Then he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures, and said to them, “Thus it is written, that the Christ should suffer and on the third day rise from the dead, and that repentance and forgiveness of sins should be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem. You are witnesses of these things.
nuance_note: 'Proclaimed' (κηρύσσειν) implies an authoritative, public declaration of the message of salvation. 'Forgiveness' (ἄφεσιν) means remission or release from the penalty and power of sins.

phrase_cn: 所以我告诉你，她许多的罪都赦免了，因为她爱得多；但那赦免少的，他爱得就少。
phrase_en: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven—for she loved much. But he who is forgiven little, loves little.”
sentence_context: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven—for she loved much. But he who is forgiven little, loves little.”
nuance_note: 'Forgiven' (ἀφέωνται) denotes a complete cancellation of debt or offense, leading to reconciliation and restoration.

phrase_cn: 叫他的百姓因罪得赦，就知道救恩。
phrase_en: to give knowledge of salvation to his people in the forgiveness of their sins,
sentence_context: And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High; for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways, to give knowledge of salvation to his people in the forgiveness of their sins,
nuance_note: Knowledge of salvation (拯救知识) is intrinsically linked with the forgiveness of sins (罪得赦免).

phrase_cn: 那天使对他们说：“不要惧怕！我报给你们大喜的信息，是关乎万民的。
phrase_en: And the angel said to them, “Fear not, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
sentence_context: And the angel said to them, “Fear not, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
nuance_note: The 'good news' (福音) is not merely 'happy news' but the divinely revealed message of salvation for all humanity.

phrase_cn: 你们要结出果子来，与悔改的心相称。
phrase_en: Bear fruits in keeping with repentance.
sentence_context: Bear fruits in keeping with repentance. Do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you, God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.”
nuance_note: 'Fruits' (果子) here signifies outward actions that demonstrate an internal change of heart and mind (μετάνοια).

phrase_cn: 但耶稣对他们说：“我也必须在别城传上帝国的福音，因我奉差原是为此。”
phrase_en: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns as well; for I was sent for this purpose.”
sentence_context: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns as well; for I was sent for this purpose.”
nuance_note: Jesus' divine 'purpose' (目的) is to 'proclaim' (传扬) the specific 'good news' (福音) of God's kingdom, not merely pleasant tidings.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对那女人说：“你的信救了你，平平安安地走吧！”
phrase_en: And he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
sentence_context: And he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
nuance_note: 'Saved' (拯救) here refers to spiritual salvation and the forgiveness of sins, not just physical rescue.

phrase_cn: 人子来不是要灭人的性命，是要救人的性命。”
phrase_en: For the Son of Man came not to destroy people's lives but to save them.”
sentence_context: And they went on to another village. For the Son of Man came not to destroy people's lives but to save them.”
nuance_note: This verse directly states the mission of the 'Son of Man' (人子) to 'save' (拯救) humanity, contrasting with destruction.

phrase_cn: 正在那时，耶稣被圣灵感动就欢乐，说：“父啊，天地的主，我感谢你！因为你将这些事向聪明通达人藏起来，向婴孩就显出来。父啊，是的，因为你的美意本是如此。
phrase_en: In that same hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and revealed them to little children; yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.”
sentence_context: In that same hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and revealed them to little children; yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.”
nuance_note: Jesus' 'rejoicing' (欢喜) is a profound spiritual joy over God's sovereign choice to reveal truth to the humble, likened to children, rather than the self-proclaimed wise.

phrase_cn: 我告诉你们，不是的！你们若不悔改，都要如此灭亡！”
phrase_en: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”
sentence_context: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”
nuance_note: 'Perish' (灭亡) implies eternal destruction, emphasizing the urgency and necessity of 'repentance' (μετάνοια).

phrase_cn: 因为我这个儿子是死而复活，失而又得的。他们就快乐起来。
phrase_en: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ And they began to celebrate.
sentence_context: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ And they began to celebrate.
nuance_note: The 'lost and found' (失而复得) motif powerfully illustrates the spiritual renewal of a 'sinner' (罪人) and the accompanying divine 'celebration' (欢庆).

phrase_cn: 当下耶稣说：“父啊，赦免他们！因为他们所做的，他们不晓得。”
phrase_en: And Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.”
sentence_context: And Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” And they cast lots to divide his garments.
nuance_note: Jesus' prayer for 'forgiveness' (赦免) for his executioners exemplifies the ultimate expression of divine mercy, even in suffering.

phrase_cn: 赦免我们的罪债
phrase_en: forgive us our sins
sentence_context: And forgive us our sins, for we ourselves forgive everyone who is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation.”
nuance_note: 'Sins' (ἁμαρτίας, hamartias) are more than just 'bad actions'; they represent falling short of God's perfect standard.

phrase_cn: 你们贫穷的人有福了
phrase_en: Blessed are you who are poor
sentence_context: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said: “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
nuance_note: 'Poor' (πτωχοί, ptōchoi) here often refers to spiritual destitution and dependence on God, not solely material lack.

phrase_cn: 他们就必悔改
phrase_en: they will repent
sentence_context: And he said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
nuance_note: 'Repent' (μετανοέω, metanoeō) means a fundamental change of mind, heart, and direction, not just feeling sorry for sin.

phrase_cn: 百姓都因他所行一切荣耀的事欢喜
phrase_en: all the people rejoiced at all the glorious things that were done by him
sentence_context: As he said these things, all his adversaries were put to shame, and all the people rejoiced at all the glorious things that were done by him.
nuance_note: 'Rejoiced' (ἔχαιρον, echairon) indicates a deep, spiritual joy and affirmation of God's powerful work, not just superficial happiness.

phrase_cn: 差遣他们去宣讲神的国和医治病人
phrase_en: And he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal
sentence_context: And he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal.
nuance_note: 'Proclaim' (κηρύσσειν, kēryssein) is an authoritative announcement, a declaration of God's redemptive rule, often accompanied by signs like healing.

phrase_cn: 你总要饶恕他
phrase_en: you must forgive him
sentence_context: And if he sins against you seven times in the day, and turns to you seven times, saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
nuance_note: The command to 'forgive' (ἀφίετε, aphiete) extends the divine principle of grace and reconciliation to human relationships.

phrase_cn: 倒要请那贫穷的、残废的、瘸腿的、瞎眼的，
phrase_en: invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
sentence_context: But when you give a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind, and you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you. For you will be repaid at the resurrection of the just.
nuance_note: The term 'poor' (πτωχός) in this context refers to those lacking not just wealth but also social standing and physical ability, often marginalized from society. 'Invite' (καλέω) here implies a proactive seeking out and inclusion.

phrase_cn: 宣讲神国的福音。
phrase_en: proclaiming and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God.
sentence_context: Soon afterward he went on through cities and villages, proclaiming and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. And the twelve were with him,
nuance_note: The term 'Good News' (εὐαγγέλιον) refers to the authoritative message of salvation and the inauguration of God's kingdom through Jesus, not merely 'happy news' in a generic sense. 'Proclaiming' (εὐαγγελίζω) highlights its active and purposeful declaration.
